1063.question: What is the performance change of the textual semantic similarity task when no error and maximum errors (noise) are present?

5-Figure5-1.png: The performance change of the textual semantic similarity task when no error and maximum errors (noise) are present is shown in the image. The two graphs represent the results of the task with different levels of error. The first graph shows the results when there is no error, while the second graph shows the results when there is a maximum amount of error. The results indicate that the task's performance can be significantly affected by the presence of noise or errors, with the task's accuracy and reli

1063.answer:
10 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  60 points when error increase by 20%
50 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  55 points when error increase by 20%
